author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Preview: Zamalek, Ahly eye second league wins over Egypt's league minnows - Egyptian Football - Sports
text:
Related Egyptian Premier League results & fixtures (2nd matchday) Zamalek to miss several key players in Aswan Egyptian league game VIDEO: El-Saied long-range looping shot gives Peseiro winning league start Zamalek suffer defensive blow as Koffi ruled out for 3 weeks Zamalek make light of backroom problems to beat Degla in league opener Missing key defenders, Egyptian champions Zamalek will be looking to record two wins out of two in the Egyptian Premier League when they visit newly-promoted Aswan on Sunday.
Having opened their title defence with a 2-0 win over Wadi Degla, Zamalek should now have a much easier mission against Aswan, who compete in the first-top for the first time since 2004.
The league newcomers didn’t enjoy a quite auspicious start to their campaign, having slumped to a 1-0 defeat at Alexandria’s Ittihad in the opening week.
Aspiring for a win against the Cairo giants could be unrealistic for Aswan, but the lowly side still could hope they would be able to capitalise on the shortage in their fancied opponents’ backline.
Right-back Hazem Emam will be serving his second game of a two-match suspension after invading the pitch during an ill-fated scuffle in the 3-2 Super Cup defeat to arch-rivals Ahly more than a week ago.
Zamalek were also dealt a blow with the news that Burkina Faso defender Mohamed Koffi will be out for up to three weeks after picking up a hamstring injury during the win over Degla.
Koffi’s blow has compounded Zamalek’s woes at the back, who are already missing regular defender Ali Gabr through an ankle problem that will sideline him for up to four weeks.
This means that a center-back partnership featuring Ahmed Dwidar and Islam Gamal is likely, after Hamada Tolba, who came on for the injured Koffi, failed to impress against Degla.
Converted right-back Ahmed Tawfik is also out of action due to automatic suspension after picking up a third yellow card – leaving Portuguese boss Jesualdo Ferreira with Tolba and Omar Gaber as the only options in the right-back slot.
Left-back Sherif Alaa has also been ruled out after picking up a hamstring strain during the Degla win, with Mohamed Adel Gomaa now likely to occupy the full-back role.
But it’s not all glum for the Whites, with midfield duo Ibrahim Salah and summer-signing Ibrahim Abdel-Khaleq now ready to make their comebacks from injury.
Zamalek forwards Ahmed Hamoudi and Ahmed Hassan Mekki have all been left out due to injury.
Ahly boosted by Evouna at Mahalla
Elsewhere, Ahly will be similarly looking for their second win in a row when they visit another newly-promoted side in Ghazl El-Mahalla on the same day.
Jose Peseiro’s men managed to edge out a resilient Talae El-Geish side 1-0, thanks to a fine lobbing shot from Abdallah El-Saied with just 15 minutes remaining.
Likewise, Mahalla – who were defeated 1-0 in their opening game at Smouha – will be looking to make the most of the absence of center-half Ramy Rabia, whose absence continues due to injury.
But they are not likely to easily find a break through the Ahly defense, with in-form center-back Ahmed Hegazy proving solid at the back.
On the flanks, however, Ahly will not be at full strength, with right-back Bassem Ali and left-back Sabri Rahil both injured.
This means that Ahmed Fathi will continue down the right, as Hussein El-Sayed might well take the left-back role.
Upfront, Ahly will be boosted by the return of Gabon striker Malick Evouna who has just recovered from injury. Former-Ismaili hitman John Antwi is already available.
But Amr Gamal has been omitted for technical reasons by the Ahly management – despite coming on as a second-half substitute late against Geish.
(For more sports news and updates, follow Ahram Online Sports on Twitter at @AO_Sports and on Facebook at AhramOnlineSports .)
